    Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Atelectasis Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Pneumonia Home

    Meta-Analysis on Postoperative Atelectasis

    dcv-atelectasis.Rmd
    library(metafor)

    Input data 

    dat.atelectasis <- escalc(measure="RR",
              ai=c(3, 2, 1, 1, 0),
              bi=c(15, 33, 43, 44, 15),
              ci=c(4, 6, 4, 2, 1),
              di=c(15, 29, 38, 43, 14),
              slab=c("Boules et al, 2011",
                     "Mahmoud et al, 2017",
                     "Li et al (Standard), 2020",
                     "Li et al (OLA), 2020",
                     "Ammar et al, 2021")
              )

    FE model 

    fe <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.atelectasis, method="FE") 
forest(fe, 
       atransf=exp,
       at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

    Standard RE model without Hartung-Knapp 

    re <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.atelectasis, method="REML") 
forest(re,
       atransf=exp,
       at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

    re
#> 
#> Random-Effects Model (k = 5; tau^2 estimator: REML)
#> 
#> tau^2 (estimated amount of total heterogeneity): 0 (SE = 0.6048)
#> tau (square root of estimated tau^2 value):      0
#> I^2 (total heterogeneity / total variability):   0.00%
#> H^2 (total variability / sampling variability):  1.00
#> 
#> Test for Heterogeneity:
#> Q(df = 4) = 1.1940, p-val = 0.8791

    Paul-Mandel without Hartung-Knapp 

    pm <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.atelectasis, method="PM") 
forest(pm,
       atransf=exp,
       at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

    pm
#> 
#> Random-Effects Model (k = 5; tau^2 estimator: PM)
#> 
#> tau^2 (estimated amount of total heterogeneity): 0 (SE = 0.6250)
#> tau (square root of estimated tau^2 value):      0
#> I^2 (total heterogeneity / total variability):   0.00%
#> H^2 (total variability / sampling variability):  1.00
#> 
#> Test for Heterogeneity:
#> Q(df = 4) = 1.1940, p-val = 0.8791
#> 
#> Model Results:
#> 
#> estimate      se     zval    pval    ci.lb   ci.ub   ​ 
#>  -0.7766  0.4205  -1.8471  0.0647  -1.6007  0.0475  .

    Paule-Mandel with Hartung-Knapp 

    pmhk <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.atelectasis, method="PM", test="knha") 
forest(pmhk,
       atransf=exp,
       at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

    Sensitivity analysis: Paule-Mandel with/without Hartung-Knapp (OR) 

    dat.atelectasis.OR <- escalc(measure="OR",
              ai=c(3, 2, 1, 1, 0),
              bi=c(15, 33, 43, 44, 15),
              ci=c(4, 6, 4, 2, 1),
              di=c(15, 29, 38, 43, 14),
              slab=c("Boules et al, 2011",
                     "Mahmoud et al, 2017",
                     "Li et al (Standard), 2020",
                     "Li et al (OLA), 2020",
                     "Ammar et al, 2021")
              )
    pm.OR <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.atelectasis.OR, method="PM") 
forest(pm.OR,
       atransf=exp,
       at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

    pm.OR
#> 
#> Random-Effects Model (k = 5; tau^2 estimator: PM)
#> 
#> tau^2 (estimated amount of total heterogeneity): 0 (SE = 0.7794)
#> tau (square root of estimated tau^2 value):      0
#> I^2 (total heterogeneity / total variability):   0.00%
#> H^2 (total variability / sampling variability):  1.00
#> 
#> Test for Heterogeneity:
#> Q(df = 4) = 1.0030, p-val = 0.9093
#> 
#> Model Results:
#> 
#> estimate      se     zval    pval    ci.lb   ci.ub   ​ 
#>  -0.9086  0.4695  -1.9351  0.0530  -1.8288  0.0117  . 
#> 
#> ---
#> Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
    
pmhk.OR <- rma(yi, vi, data=dat.atelectasis.OR, method="PM", test="knha") 
forest(pmhk.OR,
       atransf=exp,
       at=log(c(0.01, 0.1, 0.5, 1, 4, 10)))

    pmhk
#>

#> I^2 (total heterogeneity / total variability):   0.00%
#> H^2 (total variability / sampling variability):  1.00
